OTRS API documentation version 8.0.x git

http://localhost:3000

OTRS is one of the most flexible web-based ticketing systems used for Customer Service, Help Desk, IT Service Management. With a fast implementation and easy customization to your needs it helps you reducing costs and increasing the efficiency and transparency of your business communication.

Welcome

Welcome to the OTRS REST API documentation. Please find the documentation overview page at doc.otrs.com.

/api/about

/api/about get

get

Provides basic API meta data.

get /api/about

Provides basic API meta data.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Add description for example responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Product": "OTRS",
  "ProductName": "My OTRS",
  "Version": "8.0.12"
}

/api/agent

/api/agent/account get

get

Get related data of the currently logged in user.

get /api/agent/account

Get related data of the currently logged in user.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the user related data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "AdminCommunicationLogPageShown": "25",
  "AdminDynamicFieldsOverviewPageShown": "25",
  "AgentDocumentSearchPageShown": "10",
  "ChangeTime": "2018-11-28 16:13:23",
  "CreateTime": "2018-11-28 16:13:23",
  "HasAdminInterfaceAccess": 1,
  "UserEmail": "agent-1@localhost",
  "UserFAQJournalOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserFAQOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserFirstname": "agent-1",
  "UserFullname": "agent-1 agent-1",
  "UserID": 2,
  "UserLastLogin": "1544179880",
  "UserLastLoginTimestamp": "2018-12-07 10:51:20",
  "UserLastname": "agent-1",
  "UserLogin": "agent-1",
  "UserLoginFailed": "0",
  "UserMobile": "",
  "UserNotificationViewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserRefreshTime": "0",
  "UserTicketOverviewMediumPageShown": "20",
  "UserTicketOverviewPreviewPageShown": "15",
  "UserTicketOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserTitle": null,
  "ValidID": 1
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/password-change post

post

Change the password for a agent account.

post /api/agent/account/password-change

Change the password for a agent account.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • NewPassword: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Changed the password for the current account

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "PasswordChangeFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The password could not be changed. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/personal-preferences post

post

Save personal preferences of the currently logged in user.

post /api/agent/account/personal-preferences

Save personal preferences of the currently logged in user.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that the data was successfully saved

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Indicates that was some problem while validating the data

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Password": {
      "Data": [
        "8"
      ],
      "Message": "Password must have at least %d character(s)."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSaveUserPreference",
    "ErrorMessage": "The user preference setting could not be saved."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/recover post

post

Request password recovery for a agent account.

post /api/agent/account/recover

Request password recovery for a agent account.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Username: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Password recovery instructions were sent via email.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "EmailSendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The password recovery instructions could not be sent via email. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

/api/agent/account/twofactor/available-method-list get

get

Get avilable two-factor method list of for a agent.

get /api/agent/account/twofactor/available-method-list

Get avilable two-factor method list of for a agent.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the avilable two-factor method list for a agent.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "TwoFactorAvailableMethodList": [
    {
      "EnterSetupCodeMessage": {
        "Message": "Please enter the 6-digit code that is displayed in your two-factor authenticator app."
      },
      "GetSetupErrorMessage": 1,
      "IsMethodSetupForUser": 1,
      "IsSendingTokenViaTransport": 0,
      "IsSetupPossible": 1,
      "Label": "App",
      "Name": "AuthenticatorApp"
    }
  ]
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/twofactor/delete-setup/{TwoFactorMethod} post

post

Delete setup for given two-factor method.

post /api/agent/account/twofactor/delete-setup/{TwoFactorMethod}

Delete setup for given two-factor method.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TwoFactorMethod: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the result of the two-factor setup delete.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DeleteSetupFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor method setup could not be deleted."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DeleteSetupNotPossible",
    "ErrorMessage": "The setup can not be deleted. At least one two-factor setup is required."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/twofactor/password-check post

post

Check if the current password is valid for the user.

post /api/agent/account/twofactor/password-check

Check if the current password is valid for the user.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Password: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Valid password check for the current user.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "PasswordInvalid",
    "ErrorMessage": "The given password is invalid."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/twofactor/revoke-browser-trust post

post

Cleans up all the trusted browsers.

post /api/agent/account/twofactor/revoke-browser-trust

Cleans up all the trusted browsers.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the result of the browser cleanup.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "BrowserTrustCleanupForUser": 1
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "BrowserTrustCleanupFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The cleanup of trusted browsers has failed."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/account/twofactor/secret-verify/{TwoFactorMethod} post

post

Check if the given token is correct to verify the secret.

post /api/agent/account/twofactor/secret-verify/{TwoFactorMethod}

Check if the given token is correct to verify the secret.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TwoFactorMethod: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • EmailSecurity: (string)
  • PhoneNumber: (string)
  • Secret: required(string)
  • Token: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Secret correctly verified with the given token.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "TokenInvalid",
    "ErrorMessage": "The given token is invalid for the secret."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token could not be sent for the given two-factor method. The limit for this hour is reached."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token for the given method could not be sent. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/auth/check get

get

Checks if authentication token is valid.

    true

HTTP status code 200

Authentication token is valid.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

HTTP status code 403

/api/agent/auth/cookie get

get

Some endpoints cannot be accessed via the usual HTTP Authorize header, for example the fetching of inline images. Only for these, we use cookies. This endpoint is used to generate an httpOnly cookie with the token information in case the user does have a valid token. Otherwise, the cookie will be deleted.

get /api/agent/auth/cookie

Some endpoints cannot be accessed via the usual HTTP Authorize header, for example the fetching of inline images. Only for these, we use cookies. This endpoint is used to generate an httpOnly cookie with the token information in case the user does have a valid token. Otherwise, the cookie will be deleted.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Success response, will create or clear the access token cookie.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

/api/agent/auth/login post

post

Authenticate against the OTRS API (either with form or SSO data), creates an access token.

post /api/agent/auth/login

Authenticate against the OTRS API (either with form or SSO data), creates an access token.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • DeviceUUID: (string)
  • FromClient: (string)
  • IsInteractive: (string)
  • OneTimeOnly: (string)
  • Password: (string)
  • TrustDevice: (string)
  • TwoFactorToken: (string)
  • Username: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Return access token after successful login.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "PostAuth": {
    "Config": {},
    "Modules": "PasswordChange"
  },
  "Token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJeyJhdWQiOiJjdXN0b21lc"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotGenerateToken",
    "ErrorMessage": "The token could not be generated."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitPerUserReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session per user limit is reached. Please try again later."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session limit is reached. Please try again later."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SystemContractSessionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "Login rejected! You have exceeded the maximum number of concurrent agents. Please contact sales@otrs.com immediately."
  }
]

/api/agent/auth/logout post

post

Logout from the OTRS API, delete the token.

post /api/agent/auth/logout

Logout from the OTRS API, delete the token.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Logged out successfully.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

/api/agent/auth/one-time-login post

post

One-time authentication via a temporary-issued token for agents.

  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • FromClient: (string)
  • IsInteractive: (string)
  • OneTimeTokenBase64: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Exchanged a temporary-issued for a regular access token.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "PostAuth": {
    "Config": {},
    "Modules": "PasswordChange"
  },
  "Token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJeyJhdWQiOiJjdXN0b21lc"
}

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

/api/agent/auth/postauth get

get

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

get /api/agent/auth/postauth

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the next post auth steps if a step is needed or nothing, if no step is needed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Config": {
    "ChangeAfterFirstLogin": 1
  },
  "Modules": "PasswordChange"
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/auth/postauth/{Check} get

get

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

get /api/agent/auth/postauth/{Check}

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • Check: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the next post auth steps if a step is needed or nothing, if no step is needed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

  "Config": {
    "ChangeAfterFirstLogin": 1
  },
  "Modules": "PasswordChange"
}

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

/api/agent/auth/sso-check get

get

Check user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

get /api/agent/auth/sso-check

Check user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Request has passed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 401

Request has failed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "AuthTwoFactorRequired",
    "ErrorMessage": "A user is required to complete two-factor authentication challenge."
  }
]

/api/agent/auth/sso-check/{DeviceUUID} get

get

Check user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

get /api/agent/auth/sso-check/{DeviceUUID}

Check user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

  • Request
  • Response

URI Parameters

  • DeviceUUID: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Request has passed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 401

Request has failed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "AuthTwoFactorRequired",
    "ErrorMessage": "A user is required to complete two-factor authentication challenge."
  }
]

/api/agent/auth/switchtouser post

post

Switch to another agent or customer

post /api/agent/auth/switchtouser

Switch to another agent or customer

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • CustomerUserID: (string)

    Example:

    customeruser1
  • UserLogin: (string)

    Example:

    MyAgentLogin

HTTP status code 200

Returns permission flag based on admin membership and active SwitchToUser feature.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Token": "eyJhbGcajE1NDc0ODQ1MDN9.UuECuGKYRWgTFSSQIPSDxPn5EIBEx2PlC1-aMB4B-DM"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotGenerateToken",
    "ErrorMessage": "The token could not be updated."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "NoSwitchPermission",
    "ErrorMessage": "You are not allowed to switch to another user."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitPerUserReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session per user limit is reached. Please try again later."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session limit is reached. Please try again later."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SystemContractSessionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "Login rejected! You have exceeded the maximum number of concurrent agents. Please contact sales@otrs.com immediately."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/auth/switchtousercheck get

get

Checks permissions of the currently logged in user to switch to other agent or customer

get /api/agent/auth/switchtousercheck

Checks permissions of the currently logged in user to switch to other agent or customer

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • Check: required(string)

    Example:

    Agent

HTTP status code 200

Returns permission flag based on admin membership and active SwitchToUser feature.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Permitted": 1
}

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Password: (string)
  • Username: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Type: any

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token could not be sent for the given two-factor method. The limit for this hour is reached."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token for the given method could not be sent. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    true

HTTP status code 200

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

  "TwoFactorSetupList": [
    {
      "Label": "App",
      "Name": "AuthenticatorApp",
      "RequestVerificationCodeMessage": {
        "Message": "Request verification code through %s",
        "Placeholder": "App"
      }
    }
  ]
}

/api/agent/calendar/appointment/copy post

post

Create calendar appointment.

post /api/agent/calendar/appointment/copy

Create calendar appointment.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • AllDay: (string)
  • CalendarID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Description: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • EndTime: required(string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Location: (string)
  • NotificationCustom: (string)
  • NotificationCustomDateTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • NotificationCustomRelativePointOfTime: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnit: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnitCount: (string)
  • NotificationTemplate: (string)
  • NotificationTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • ParentID: (string)
  • Plugins: (string)
  • RecurrenceCount: (string)
  • RecurrenceExclude: (string)
  • RecurrenceFrequency: (string)
  • RecurrenceID: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • RecurrenceInterval: (string)
  • RecurrenceType: (string)
  • RecurrenceUntil: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Recurring: (string)
  • RecurringRaw: (string)
  • ResourceID: (string)
  • StartTime: required(string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • TeamID: (string)
  • Title: required(string)
  • UniqueID: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Create calendar appointment.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "AppointmentID": 123
}

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateCalendarAppointment",
    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateCalendarAppointment",
    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/calendar/appointment/create post

post

Create calendar appointment.

post /api/agent/calendar/appointment/create

Create calendar appointment.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • AllDay: (string)
  • CalendarID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Description: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • EndTime: required(string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Location: (string)
  • NotificationCustom: (string)
  • NotificationCustomDateTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • NotificationCustomRelativePointOfTime: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnit: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnitCount: (string)
  • NotificationTemplate: (string)
  • NotificationTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • ParentID: (string)
  • Plugins: (string)
  • RecurrenceCount: (string)
  • RecurrenceExclude: (string)
  • RecurrenceFrequency: (string)
  • RecurrenceID: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • RecurrenceInterval: (string)
  • RecurrenceType: (string)
  • RecurrenceUntil: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Recurring: (string)
  • RecurringRaw: (string)
  • ResourceID: (string)
  • StartTime: required(string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • TeamID: (string)
  • Title: required(string)
  • UniqueID: (string)

    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/calendar/appointment/delete/{AppointmentID} delete

delete

Delete calendar appointment.

delete /api/agent/calendar/appointment/delete/{AppointmentID}

Delete calendar appointment.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • AppointmentID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Delete calendar appointment.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "AppointmentID": 123
}

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotDeleteCalendarAppointment",
    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be deleted. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/calendar/appointment/list post

post

Get calendar appointment list.

post /api/agent/calendar/appointment/list

Get calendar appointment list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get calendar appointment list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Age": 0,
      "AllDay": 0,
      "AppointmentID": 147,
      "CalendarID": 207,
      "CalendarName": "Calendar",
      "ChangeBy": 1,
      "ChangeTime": "2020-02-17 08:14:08",
      "CreateBy": 1,
      "CreateTime": "2020-02-17 08:14:08",
      "Description": "Description19941002724800000",
      "EndTime": "2020-02-20 12:00:00",
      "Location": "Germany",
      "NotificationCustom": "",
      "NotificationCustomDateTime": "",
      "NotificationCustomRelativePointOfTime": "",
      "NotificationCustomRelativeUnit": "",
      "NotificationCustomRelativeUnitCount": 0,
      "NotificationDate": "",
      "NotificationTemplate": "",
      "ParentID": null,
      "Plugins": {
        "Ticket": [
          {
            "ID": 1,
            "Name": "2015071510123456 Welcome to OTRS!"
          }
        ]
      },
      "RecurrenceCount": null,
      "RecurrenceExclude": [
        null
      ],
      "RecurrenceFrequency": [
        null
      ],
      "RecurrenceID": null,
      "RecurrenceInterval": 1,
      "RecurrenceType": null,
      "RecurrenceUntil": null,
      "Recurring": null,
      "ResourceID": [
        "1"
      ],
      "ResourceNames": [
        "Agent1"
      ],
      "StartTime": "2020-02-20 10:00:00",
      "TeamID": [
        "1"
      ],
      "TeamNames": [
        "Team1"
      ],
      "TicketAppointmentRuleID": null,
      "Title": "Test19941002724800000",
      "UniqueID": "20200220T100000-3E6938@localhost"
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

/api/agent/calendar/appointment/update/{AppointmentID} post

post

Update calendar appointment.

post /api/agent/calendar/appointment/update/{AppointmentID}

Update calendar appointment.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • AppointmentID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • AllDay: (string)
  • CalendarID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Description: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • EndTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Location: (string)
  • NotificationCustom: (string)
  • NotificationCustomDateTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • NotificationCustomRelativePointOfTime: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnit: (string)
  • NotificationCustomRelativeUnitCount: (string)
  • NotificationTemplate: (string)
  • NotificationTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • ParentID: (string)
  • Plugins: (string)
  • RecurrenceCount: (string)
  • RecurrenceExclude: (string)
  • RecurrenceFrequency: (string)
  • RecurrenceID: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • RecurrenceInterval: (string)
  • RecurrenceType: (string)
  • RecurrenceUntil: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • Recurring: (string)
  • RecurringRaw: (string)
  • ResourceID: (string)
  • StartTime: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • TeamID: (string)
  • Title: (string)
  • UniqueID: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateCalendarAppointment",
    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateCalendarAppointment",
    "ErrorMessage": "The calendar appointment could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

/api/agent/chat/request/count post

post
