post /api/agent/chat/request/count

Get chat requests count.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Return the chat requests count.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/chat/request/list post

post

Get Chat Request list.

post /api/agent/chat/request/list

Get Chat Request list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get Chat Request list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Channel": "Default",
      "ChatChannelID": 123,
      "ChatID": 123,
      "CreateTime": "1977-12-12 12::00:00",
      "RequesterID": 123,
      "RequesterName": "Admin OTRS",
      "RequesterType": "User",
      "Status": "request",
      "TargetType": "User",
      "TicketID": 123,
      "Type": "Request"
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/chat/{ChatID} get

get

Get chat metadata.

get /api/agent/chat/{ChatID}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ChatID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Get chat metadata.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ChatChannelID": 123,
  "ChatID": "123",
  "CreateTime": "2015-07-03 13:25:41",
  "RequesterID": "jdoe",
  "RequesterName": "John Doe",
  "RequesterType": "Customer",
  "Status": "active",
  "TargetType": "Agent",
  "TicketID": 0
}

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ChatID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

HTTP status code 200

Append chat conversation to an existing ticket.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ChatAppendFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat conversation could not be appended to the ticket. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ChatCloseFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat conversation could not be closed. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CloseMessageAddFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The closing message could not be added. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "InvitationRemoveFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat invitations could not be removed. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ParticipantRemoveFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "All other participants could not be removed. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/chat/{ChatID}/request/accept post

post

Accept chat requests.

post /api/agent/chat/{ChatID}/request/accept

Accept chat requests.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ChatID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Acept chat requests.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SetAcceptStateFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat request could not be accepted. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/customer/company/*CustomerID get

get

Retrieve information about a specific customer company.

get /api/agent/customer/company/*CustomerID

Retrieve information about a specific customer company.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns the customer company data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "CustomerID": "Example AG",
  "DynamicFields": [],
  "MapLinks": [],
  "PersonalInfo": {},
  "SocialLinks": [],
  "TicketKPI": {}
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

    Example:

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    testuser_login

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateCustomer",
    "ErrorMessage": "The customer could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DuplicateCustomerCompanyName",
    "ErrorMessage": "A customer with this name already exists. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DuplicateCustomerID",
    "ErrorMessage": "A customer with this ID already exists. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

/api/agent/customer/company/list post

post

Get customer company list.

post /api/agent/customer/company/list

Get customer company list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get customer company list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "CustomerCompanyCity": "Some city",
      "CustomerCompanyComment": "some comment",
      "CustomerCompanyCountry": "Germany",
      "CustomerCompanyName": "Example Inc",
      "CustomerCompanyStreet": "Some Street",
      "CustomerCompanyURL": "http://example.com",
      "CustomerCompanyZIP": "12345",
      "CustomerID": "example-test",
      "Source": "CustomerCompany",
      "ValidID": 1
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Counted customer users based on given filter parameters.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Count": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/customer/user/create post

post

Create a customer user.

post /api/agent/customer/user/create

Create a customer user.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • DataSource: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Create a customer user.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "CustomerUserID": 123
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateCustomerUser",
    "ErrorMessage": "The customer user could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSaveUserPreference",
    "ErrorMessage": "The user preference setting could not be saved."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DuplicateCustomerUserEmail",
    "ErrorMessage": "A customer user with this email address already exists. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DuplicateCustomerUserLogin",
    "ErrorMessage": "A customer user with this login already exists. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "InvalidCustomerCompany",
    "ErrorMessage": "This customer ID is invalid. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "InvalidEmailAddress",
    "ErrorMessage": "This email address is invalid. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "PasswordPolicyCheckPasswordHistory",
    "ErrorMessage": "The password cannot be updated. It must not be equal to the last %s passwords. Please try again.",
    "ErrorMessageParams": [
      "..."
    ]
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "PasswordPolicyRules",
    "ErrorMessage": "This password is forbidden by the current system configuration or it must not be equal to the last passwords. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/customer/user/list post

post

Get customer user list.

post /api/agent/customer/user/list

Get customer user list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get customer user list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "UserCountry": "Germany",
      "UserCustomerID": "Company AG",
      "UserEmail": "customer-1@example.com",
      "UserFirstname": "Firstname Test1",
      "UserLastname": "Lastname Test1",
      "UserLogin": "customer-1",
      "UserTitle": "Mr.",
      "ValidID": 1
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

  • Response

    true

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • UserCity: (string)
  • UserComment: (string)
  • UserCountry: (string)
  • UserCustomerID: required(string)
  • UserEmail: required(string)
  • UserFax: (string)
  • UserFirstname: required(string)
  • UserLastname: required(string)
  • UserLogin: required(string)
  • UserMobile: (string)
  • UserPassword: (string)
  • UserPhone: (string)
  • UserStreet: (string)
  • UserTitle: (string)
  • UserZip: (string)
  • ValidID: required(string)

/api/agent/documentsearch post

post

Returns the document search result for the given search query and additional filters.

post /api/agent/documentsearch

Returns the document search result for the given search query and additional filters.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DocumentSearchType: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • FilterAggregations: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • LanguageFilter: (string)
  • LoadDocumentSearchTypes: (string)
  • MaxSearchItems: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SearchItemsPerPage: (string)
  • SearchQuery: required(string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get detailed document search results.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "CategoryIDs": [
        1
      ],
      "CategoryNames": [
        "Misc"
      ],
      "ChildDocumentSearchType": null,
      "DocumentID": "1",
      "DocumentSearchType": "FAQ",
      "HighlightContents": [
        "<em>test</em>"
      ],
      "IsFromAttachment": 0,
      "Score": "1.0303539",
      "Title": "Test"
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

/api/agent/documentsearch/simple post

post

Returns a simple document search result for the given search query.

post /api/agent/documentsearch/simple

Returns a simple document search result for the given search query.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • LanguageFilter: (string)
  • SearchQuery: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Simple search result for the given search query.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Result": [
    {
      "SectionResult": [
        {
          "ChildDocumentSearchType": "ArticleMIME",
          "DocumentID": 123,
          "DocumentSearchType": "Ticket",
          "Score": "4.123123",
          "TicketNumber": "20180101407878",
          "Title": "Example article title"
        },
        {
          "DocumentID": 100,
          "DocumentSearchType": "Ticket",
          "Score": "3.523123",
          "TicketNumber": "20180101407878",
          "Title": "Example ticket title"
        }
      ],
      "SectionTitle": "Tickets",
      "SectionType": "Ticket"
    },
    {
      "SectionResult": [
        {
          "DocumentID": 120,
          "DocumentSearchType": "FAQ",
          "Score": "4.123123",
          "TicketNumber": [
            "Software",
            "Misc"
          ],
          "Title": "Example faq title"
        },
        {
          "Categories": [
            "Software",
            "Example"
          ],
          "DocumentID": 111,
          "DocumentSearchType": "FAQ",
          "Score": "3.523123",
          "Title": "Example faq title"
        }
      ],
      "SectionTitle": "Knowledge Base Articles",
      "SectionType": "FAQ"
    }
  ]
}

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

/api/agent/formdraft/add post

post

Add a form draft for an object.

post /api/agent/formdraft/add

Add a form draft for an object.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Action: required(string)
  • FormData: required(string)
  • FormDraftTitle: required(string)
  • FormID: (string)
  • ObjectID: required(string)
  • ObjectType: required(string)
  • UploadFields: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Form draft successfully added.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Data validation failed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ObjectID": [
    {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotAddFormDraft",
    "ErrorMessage": "The form draft could not be added."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/formdraft/list post

post

Lists form drafts.

post /api/agent/formdraft/list

Lists form drafts.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Action: (string)
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • ObjectID: required(string)
  • ObjectType: required(string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Form draft list returned successfully.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Action": "list-unittest",
      "ChangeBy": 39,
      "ChangeTime": "2019-12-03 16:57:07",
      "CreateBy": 39,
      "CreateTime": "2019-12-03 16:57:07",
      "FormDraftID": 25,
      "ObjectID": 1,
      "ObjectType": "unittest",
      "Title": "list"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Data validation failed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ObjectID": [
    {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "FormDraftListFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to get the list of form drafts."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post

  • Response
  • Security

Type: object

  • FormDraftTitle: required(string)
  • FormID: (string)
  • ObjectID: required(string)
  • ObjectType: required(string)
  • UploadFields: (string)

Receive a form draft for an object.

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • FormDraftID: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Form draft deleted successfully.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • FormDraftID: required(string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • FormID: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Form draft successfully received.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Action": "TestAction",
  "ChangeBy": 123,
  "ChangeTime": "2019-12-02 15:49:58",
  "CreateBy": 123,
  "CreateTime": "2019-12-02 15:49:58",
  "FileData": {
    "Content": "My file content ...",
    "ContentID": 123,
    "ContentType": "application/x-perl",
    "Disposition": "attachment",
    "FileID": 123,
    "Filename": "testfile.pm",
    "Filesize": "11826"
  },
  "FormData": {
    "Body": "Test body",
    "From": "testuser@testdomain.local",
    "OwnerID": 123,
    "ResponsibleID": 123,
    "StateID": 4,
    "Subject": "Re: [Ticket#2019110854000025] Test subject",
    "TimeUnits": 123,
    "To": "testcustomer@testdomain.local"
  },
  "FormDraftID": 123,
  "ObjectID": 234,
  "ObjectType": "Ticket",
  "Title": "TestDraft"
}

Data validation failed.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotPrepareFormDraftFiles",
    "ErrorMessage": "The stored form draft files could not be prepared in the web upload cache."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotReceiveFormDraft",
    "ErrorMessage": "The form draft could not be received."
  }
]

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

    Example:

    1234

    1234

HTTP status code 900

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotAddAttachment",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not add attachment."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateKnowledgeBaseArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The knowledge base article could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotDeleteAttachment",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not delete attachment."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateKnowledgeBaseArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The knowledge base article could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/delete delete

delete

Delete knowledge base articles.

delete /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/delete

Delete knowledge base articles.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ArticleIDs: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Delete knowledge base articles.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "KnowledgeBaseArticleDeleteFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not delete all knowledge base articles."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/list post

post

Get knowledge base article list.

post /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/list

Get knowledge base article list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get knowledge base article list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Approved": 1,
      "Category": "Example",
      "CategoryID": 2,
      "CategoryName": "Example",
      "CategoryShortName": "Example",
      "Changed": "2019-09-18 10:00:00",
      "ChangedBy": 1,
      "ContentType": "text/html",
      "Created": "2019-09-18 10:00:00",
      "CreatedBy": 1,
      "FAQID": 2,
      "Helpful": 0,
      "ID": 2,
      "ItemID": 2,
      "Keywords": "some keywords",
      "Language": "en",
      "LanguageID": 1,
      "Name": "Example Article",
      "NotHelpful": 0,
      "Number": 1,
      "State": "internal (agent)",
      "StateID": 1,
      "StateTypeID": 1,
      "StateTypeName": "internal",
      "Title": "Some Title",
      "Valid": "valid",
      "ValidID": 1
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

Generates and returns the attachment content for the list export.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • Columns: required(string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • Format: required(string)
  • Language: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SelectedItemIDs: (string)
  • SortBy: required(string)

Indicates that the attachment was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotAddAttachment",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not add attachment."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateKnowledgeBaseArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The knowledge base article could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotDeleteAttachment",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not delete attachment."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateKnowledgeBaseArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The knowledge base article could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

get

Gets knowledge base article attachments.

head

Gets knowledge base article attachments.

get /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/attachments/download

Gets knowledge base article attachments.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

HTTP status code 403

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the knowledge base article or the article is not visible).

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotWriteZipFile",
    "ErrorMessage": "Error while trying to write ZIP archive file."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

head /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/attachments/download

Gets knowledge base article attachments.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/attachments/list post

post

Lists knowledge base article attachments.

post /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/attachments/list

Lists knowledge base article attachments.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the knowledge base article, is not visible).

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/history get

get

Get the history information for a knowledge base article.

get /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/history

Get the history information for a knowledge base article.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "History": [
    {
      "Data": [
        {
          "HistoryData": [
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Created",
              "Values": []
            }
          ],
          "UserData": {
            "UserEmail": "test3911606291400001@localunittest.com",
            "UserFirstname": "test3911606291400001",
            "UserFullname": "test3911606291400001 test3911606291400001",
            "UserID": 32,
            "UserLastname": "test3911606291400001"
          }
        }
      ],
      "TimeStamp": "2019-12-13 10:36:49"
    },
    {
      "Data": [
        {
          "HistoryData": [
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Updated",
              "Values": []
            },
            {
              "HistoryRow": "DynamicField %s updated",
              "Values": [
                "ABC"
              ]
            }
          ],
          "UserData": {
            "UserEmail": "test3911606291400001@localunittest.com",
            "UserFirstname": "test3911606291400001",
            "UserFullname": "test3911606291400001 test3911606291400001",
            "UserID": 32,
            "UserLastname": "test3911606291400001"
          }
        }
      ],
      "TimeStamp": "2019-12-17 16:01:18"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}
