/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/property/{PropertyName} get post

get

Gets the knowledge base article property value.

post

Updates the knowledge base article property value.

get /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/property/{PropertyName}

Gets the knowledge base article property value.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • PropertyName: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "GetPropertyDataFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to get the property data. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/property/{PropertyName}

Updates the knowledge base article property value.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • PropertyName: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully updated.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "UpdatePropertyFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to update the property. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/vote/check get

get

Check the voting status.

get /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/vote/check

Check the voting status.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ShowVotingWidget": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/vote/send post

post

Sends the vote for a knowledge base article.

post /api/agent/knowledge-base-article/{ArticleID}/vote/send

Sends the vote for a knowledge base article.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Vote: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Sends the vote for a knowledge base article.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotVote",
    "ErrorMessage": "The voting could not be saved."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/link-object/add post

post

Adds a link between objects.

post /api/agent/link-object/add

Adds a link between objects.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Mode: (string)
  • SourceKey: required(string)
  • SourceObject: required(string)
  • TargetKeys: required(string)
  • TargetObject: required(string)
  • TypeIdentifier: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Adds links between objects.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "LinkIDs": [
    1,
    2,
    3,
    4
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LinkAddFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not add link."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 403

/api/agent/link-object/delete delete

delete

Delete links between objects.

delete /api/agent/link-object/delete

Delete links between objects.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • LinkIDs: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Delete links between objects.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

Type: any

  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

HTTP status code 900

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LinkDeleteFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not delete all links."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/link-object/list post

post

Get link objects list.

post /api/agent/link-object/list

Get link objects list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • CurrentObjectID: required(string)
  • CurrentObjectType: required(string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • LinkObjectType: required(string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get link objects list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Age": 4912,
      "ArchiveFlag": "n",
      "ChangeBy": 2,
      "Changed": "2019-06-10 12:04:12",
      "CreateBy": 1,
      "Created": "2019-06-10 11:43:01",
      "CustomerCompanyName": null,
      "CustomerID": "customer-1",
      "CustomerName": "customer-1 customer-1",
      "CustomerUserID": "customer-1",
      "DynamicField_DFDate": "2019-06-10 12:03:00",
      "DynamicField_DFText": "Dynamic field TEXT",
      "EscalationResponseTime": 0,
      "EscalationSolutionTime": 0,
      "EscalationTime": 0,
      "EscalationUpdateTime": 0,
      "GroupID": 1,
      "LinkData": {
        "Direction": "Target",
        "ObjectID": 1234,
        "ObjectType": "Ticket",
        "Type": "Normal"
      },
      "LinkID": 1234,
      "Lock": "unlock",
      "LockID": 1,
      "Owner": "Admin OTRS",
      "OwnerID": 1,
      "Priority": "3 normal",
      "PriorityID": 3,
      "Queue": "Postmaster",
      "QueueID": 1,
      "RealTillTimeNotUsed": 0,
      "Responsible": "Admin OTRS",
      "ResponsibleID": 1,
      "SLAID": "",
      "ServiceID": "",
      "State": "new",
      "StateID": 1,
      "StateType": "new",
      "Subject": "Ticket subject",
      "TicketID": 1234,
      "TicketNumber": "2019061054000012",
      "Title": "Ticket subject",
      "Type": "Unclassified",
      "TypeID": 1,
      "UnlockTimeout": 1560168251,
      "UntilTime": 0,
      "UntilTimeDestinationDate": 0
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/people/status-lists post

post

Returns the people status lists for the different user types.

post /api/agent/people/status-lists

Returns the people status lists for the different user types.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Agents: (string)
  • Customers: (string)
  • OutOfOffice: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns people status lists for the different users.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "OnlineAgents": [],
  "OnlineCustomers": [],
  "OutOfOffice": []
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/push-events/handler/{FrontendClientID} get

get

Handles the push event messages by the FrontendClientID.

get /api/agent/push-events/handler/{FrontendClientID}

Handles the push event messages by the FrontendClientID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • FrontendClientID: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the push event messages.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "PushEvents": [
    {
      "Data": {},
      "Name": "TicketTitleUpdate::TicketID::1234::UserID::1"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "MessageDeleteFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The push event messages could not be deleted."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/push-events/subscription post

post

Handles the push event subscriptions for the given FrontendClientID.

post /api/agent/push-events/subscription

Handles the push event subscriptions for the given FrontendClientID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • FrontendClientID: required(string)
  • Subscriptions: (string)

HTTP status code 200

The push event subscriptions were successfully handled.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "MaxSubscriptionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The subscription limit per front end client ID is reached."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "RefreshFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The push event subscriptions could not be refreshed."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post

  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • CacheTTL: (string)
  • QueuePermissionGroup: (string)
  • States: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Items": {
    "Queue1": {
      "ID": 123,
      "Queue": "Queue1",
      "State1": 1,
      "State2": 3,
      "Total": 3
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateReport",
    "ErrorMessage": "The report could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateReport",
    "ErrorMessage": "The report could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ReportNameNotUnique",
    "ErrorMessage": "This report name is already in use. Please choose a different one."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 900

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    1.0.0

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticReportDeleteFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Not all reports could be deleted."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic-report/list post

post

Get report list.

post /api/agent/statistic-report/list

Get report list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get report list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "ChangeTime": "2019-12-01 13:00:00",
      "Config": {},
      "CreateTime": "2019-12-01 12:00:00",
      "CronDefinition": "* * * * *",
      "Description": "Test",
      "ID": 12,
      "Language": "English (United States)",
      "LanguageID": "en",
      "Name": "Test",
      "ReportID": 12,
      "RunIsUsable": 1,
      "Valid": "valid",
      "ValidID": 1
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic-report/update/{ReportID} post

post

Updates the report with the given ID.

post /api/agent/statistic-report/update/{ReportID}

Updates the report with the given ID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • ReportID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Config: required(string)
  • Name: required(string)
  • ValidID: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that report was successfully updated.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateReport",
    "ErrorMessage": "The report could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateReport",
    "ErrorMessage": "The report could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ReportNameNotUnique",
    "ErrorMessage": "This report name is already in use. Please choose a different one."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

  • Response
  • Security

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Description: required(string)
  • Format: required(string)
  • ObjectModule: required(string)
  • ObjectType: required(string)
  • Permission: required(string)
  • StatType: required(string)
  • SumCol: (string)
  • SumRow: (string)
  • TimeZone: (string)
  • Title: required(string)
  • Valid: (string)

Indicates that statistic was successfully created.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

Type: any

    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateStatistic",
    "ErrorMessage": "The statistic could not be created. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ObjectModuleCheck",
    "ErrorMessage": "The object module check has failed. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

    Example:

    true

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

post

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get statistic list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Changed": "2019-12-02 10:00:00",
      "ChangedBy": "Admin OTRS",
      "Created": "2019-12-02 10:00:00",
      "CreatedBy": "Admin OTRS",
      "Description": "some Description",
      "Format": [
        "CSV"
      ],
      "Object": "Ticket",
      "ObjectBehaviours": {
        "ProvidesDashboardWidget": 1
      },
      "ObjectModule": "Kernel::System::Stats::Dynamic::Ticket",
      "ObjectName": "TicketAccumulation",
      "ObjectType": "DynamicMatrix",
      "Permission": [
        1
      ],
      "StatID": 1,
      "StatNumber": "10001",
      "StatType": "Dynamic",
      "StatisticID": 1,
      "SumCol": "1",
      "SumRow": "1",
      "TimeZone": "UTC",
      "Title": "Some Title",
      "Valid": "valid"
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic/update/{StatisticID} post

post

Update the statistic with the given ID.

post /api/agent/statistic/update/{StatisticID}

Update the statistic with the given ID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • StatisticID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Cache: (string)
  • Description: required(string)
  • Format: required(string)
  • Permission: required(string)
  • ShowAsDashboardWidget: (string)
  • SumCol: (string)
  • SumRow: (string)
  • TimeZone: (string)
  • Title: required(string)
  • Valid: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that statistic was successfully updated.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateStatisticUpdateData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The statistic could not be updated. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID} get

get

Returns the information about a statistic giving its ID.

get /api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}

Returns the information about a statistic giving its ID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • StatisticID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that statistic data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/export get

get

Export statistic.

get /api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/export

Export statistic.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • StatisticID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Export statistic.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticExportFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not export statistic."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/result post

post

Returns the result information about a statistic with its ID.

post /api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/result

Returns the result information about a statistic with its ID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • StatisticID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that statistic result data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "StatisticResultData": []
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "NoStatisticData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The content of this statistic is being prepared for you. Please be patient."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationUserError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please review your settings."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/result/download/{Format} head post

head

Returns the result information document about a statistic with the ID as download file.

post

Returns the result information document about a statistic with the ID as download file.

head /api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/result/download/{Format}

Returns the result information document about a statistic with the ID as download file.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • StatisticID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Format: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 403

No access to the statistic.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "NoStatisticData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The content of this statistic is being prepared for you. Please be patient."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationUserError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please review your settings."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post /api/agent/statistic/{StatisticID}/result/download/{Format}

Returns the result information document about a statistic with the ID as download file.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 900

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "NoStatisticData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The content of this statistic is being prepared for you. Please be patient."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "StatisticConfigurationUserError",
    "ErrorMessage": "The configuration for this statistic widget contains errors. Please review your settings."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/count post

post

Get ticket count.

post /api/agent/ticket/count

Get ticket count.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get ticket count.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Count": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

  • Response
  • Security

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • AccountedTime: (string)
  • Bcc: (string)
  • Body: required(string)
  • Cc: (string)
  • CustomerID: (string)

    Example:

    companyname
  • CustomerUserID: (string)
  • EmailSecurity: (string)
  • FormID: (string)
  • HistoryComment: (string)
  • HistoryType: required(string)
  • IsVisibleForCustomer: required(string)
  • LinkTicketID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • LinkType: (string)
  • OwnerID: (string)

    Example:

    12
  • PendingDate: (string)

    Example:

    2018-04-25 14:26:15
  • PriorityID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • QueueID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ResponsibleID: (string)

    Example:

    12
  • SLAID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • SenderType: required(string)
  • ServiceID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • StateID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Subject: required(string)
  • To: required(string)
  • TypeID: (string)

    Example:

    1234

Create new email ticket.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

  "ArticleID": 123,
  "TicketID": 123,

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)
