HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ArticleSendFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "System was not able to create article."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "InvalidEmail",
    "ErrorMessage": "Invalid email address in To, Cc or Bcc field."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LinkFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "You do not have permission to link the ticket."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

/api/agent/ticket/id/{TicketID} get

get

Returns the information about a ticket giving its ID.

get /api/agent/ticket/id/{TicketID}

Returns the information about a ticket giving its ID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • TicketActions: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

/api/agent/ticket/list post

post

Get ticket list.

post /api/agent/ticket/list

Get ticket list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get ticket list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Age": 4912,
      "ArchiveFlag": "n",
      "ChangeBy": 2,
      "Changed": "2019-06-10 12:04:12",
      "CreateBy": 1,
      "Created": "2019-06-10 11:43:01",
      "CustomerCompanyName": null,
      "CustomerID": "customer-1",
      "CustomerName": "customer-1 customer-1",
      "CustomerUserID": "customer-1",
      "DynamicField_DFDate": "2019-06-10 12:03:00",
      "DynamicField_DFText": "Dynamic field TEXT",
      "EscalationResponseTime": 0,
      "EscalationSolutionTime": 0,
      "EscalationTime": 0,
      "EscalationUpdateTime": 0,
      "GroupID": 1,
      "Lock": "unlock",
      "LockID": 1,
      "Owner": "Admin OTRS",
      "OwnerID": 1,
      "Priority": "3 normal",
      "PriorityID": 3,
      "Queue": "Postmaster",
      "QueueID": 1,
      "RealTillTimeNotUsed": 0,
      "Responsible": "Admin OTRS",
      "ResponsibleID": 1,
      "SLAID": "",
      "ServiceID": "",
      "State": "new",
      "StateID": 1,
      "StateType": "new",
      "Subject": "Ticket subject",
      "TicketID": 1234,
      "TicketNumber": "2019061054000012",
      "Title": "Ticket subject",
      "Type": "Unclassified",
      "TypeID": 1,
      "UnlockTimeout": 1560168251,
      "UntilTime": 0,
      "UntilTimeDestinationDate": 0
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/list/export get head

get

Generates and returns the attachment content for the list export.

head

Generates and returns the attachment content for the list export.

get /api/agent/ticket/list/export

Generates and returns the attachment content for the list export.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • Columns: required(string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • Format: required(string)
  • Language: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SelectedItemIDs: (string)
  • SortBy: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that the attachment was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

  • Response

    Example:

    true

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

HTTP status code 422

Invalid ticket data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field2": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field3": {
      "Validator": "IncorrectDisplayConfig"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicketArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotPrepareData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The data could not be prepared for storage."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicFieldValue",
    "ErrorMessage": "The dynamic field values could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetTicketProcessState",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket process state could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket information could not be updated."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LinkFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "You do not have permission to link the ticket."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ActivityStatus": "UserTaskPending",
  "Data": {
    "All": {
      "Text2test1051809449700000": {
        "Config": {
          "DefaultValue": "Default",
          "FieldType": "Text",
          "Label": "Text2test1051809449700000",
          "Order": 9992
        },
        "Value": {
          "Link": "",
          "LinkPreview": "",
          "Value": "Test 1234"
        }
      },
      "Texttest1051809449700000": {
        "Config": {
          "DefaultValue": "Default",
          "FieldType": "Text",
          "Label": "Texttest1051809449700000",
          "Order": 9991
        },
        "Value": {
          "Link": "",
          "LinkPreview": "",
          "Value": "Test 1234"
        }
      }
    },
    "ByGroup": {
      "Test": {
        "Text2test1051809449700000": {
          "Config": {
            "DefaultValue": "Default",
            "FieldType": "Text",
            "Label": "Text2test1051809449700000",
            "Order": 9992
          },
          "Value": {
            "Link": "",
            "LinkPreview": "",
            "Value": "Test 1234"
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "NoGroup": {
      "Texttest1051809449700000": {
        "Config": {
          "DefaultValue": "Default",
          "FieldType": "Text",
          "Label": "Texttest1051809449700000",
          "Order": 9991
        },
        "Value": {
          "Link": "",
          "LinkPreview": "",
          "Value": "Test 1234"
        }
      }
    }
  },
  "NextSteps": [
    {
      "ActivityDialogEntityID": "AD1",
      "DescriptionLong": "",
      "DescriptionShort": "Start AD",
      "Name": "Start AD",
      "ProcessEntityID": "P1",
      "TicketID": 331
    }
  ]
}

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

    1.0.0

    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."

  }

/api/agent/ticket/updatecheck post

post

Checks for updated and new tickets in a list.

post /api/agent/ticket/updatecheck

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • CheckUserActivity: (string)
  • FetchDetailData: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • Parameters: required(string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Add description for example responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    1,
    2,
    3
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/watch/{Watch} post

post

Watch or unwatch tickets.

post /api/agent/ticket/watch/{Watch}

Watch or unwatch tickets.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • Watch: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • TicketIDs: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Watch or unwatch tickets.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SetWatchStateFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to set the watch state. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/list post

post

Get ticket article list.

post /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/list

Get ticket article list.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Get ticket article list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "ArticleID": 123,
      "ArticleIcon": "regular,envelope",
      "ArticleNumber": 1,
      "ArticleProperties": {
        "Seen": 1
      },
      "Attachment": {},
      "AttachmentCount": 0,
      "AttachmentDownloadType": "attachment",
      "Bcc": "",
      "Body": "the message text",
      "Cc": "",
      "ChangeBy": 1,
      "ChangeTime": "2018-10-01 10:00:00",
      "Charset": "ISO-8859-15",
      "CommunicationChannel": {
        "DisplayName": "Email",
        "Invalid": "",
        "Name": "Email"
      },
      "CommunicationChannelID": 1,
      "ContentCharset": "ISO-8859-15",
      "ContentType": "text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-15",
      "CreateBy": 1,
      "CreateTime": "2018-10-01 10:00:00",
      "Crypted": {
        "MessageFlag": "ok",
        "MessageRaw": "Decryption successful...",
        "State": "ok",
        "Type": "SMIME"
      },
      "Direction": "Outgoing",
      "From": "",
      "InReplyTo": "",
      "IncomingTime": 1538388000,
      "IsVisibleForCustomer": 1,
      "MessageID": "",
      "MimeType": "text/plain",
      "References": "",
      "ReplyTo": "",
      "Sender": "",
      "SenderRealname": "",
      "SenderType": "agent",
      "SenderTypeID": 1,
      "SenderUser": {},
      "Signed": {
        "MessageFlag": "ok",
        "MessageRaw": "Verification successful...",
        "State": "ok",
        "Type": "SMIME"
      },
      "Subject": "Additional info needed",
      "TicketID": 12,
      "To": "",
      "TransmissionStatus": ""
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 1,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}

      "Message": "..."

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/attachment/{AttachmentID} get head

get

Returns the attachment content for the given ticket-article.

head

Returns the attachment content for the given ticket-article.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/attachment/{AttachmentID}

Returns the attachment content for the given ticket-article.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • AttachmentID: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that the attachment was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 403

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the ticket or the article is not visible).

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/body get

get

Get article body related to TicketID and ArticleID.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/body

Get article body related to TicketID and ArticleID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return article body.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: text/html

Type: any

Example:

<pre>Some example article body!</pre>

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    true

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/attachment/get get head

get

Gets ticket attachments.

head

Gets ticket attachments.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/attachment/get

Gets ticket attachments.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

HTTP status code 403

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the ticket or the article is not visible).

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotWriteZipFile",
    "ErrorMessage": "Error while trying to write zip archive file!"
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

head /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/attachment/get

Gets ticket attachments.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

HTTP status code 403

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the ticket or the article is not visible).

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    Example:

  • Security

    Example:

    1234

Headers

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Label": "Label",
  "Value": "value",
  "ValueID": "value id"
}

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/history get

get

History information per user about a ticket.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/history

History information per user about a ticket.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • ReverseHistoryOrder: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "History": [
    {
      "Data": [
        {
          "HistoryData": [
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Sent \"%s\" notification to \"%s\" via \"%s\".",
              "Values": [
                "Ticket new note notification",
                "test3911606291400005",
                "Email"
              ]
            }
          ],
          "UserData": {
            "UserEmail": "test3911606291400001@localunittest.com",
            "UserFirstname": "test3911606291400001",
            "UserFullname": "test3911606291400001 test3911606291400001",
            "UserID": 32,
            "UserLastname": "test3911606291400001"
          }
        },
        {
          "HistoryData": [
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Last History Comment!",
              "Values": []
            },
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Reset of unlock time.",
              "Values": []
            }
          ],
          "UserData": {
            "UserEmail": "test3911606291400005@localunittest.com",
            "UserFirstname": "test3911606291400005",
            "UserFullname": "test3911606291400005 test3911606291400005",
            "UserID": 34,
            "UserLastname": "test3911606291400005"
          }
        }
      ],
      "TimeStamp": "2018-10-01 10:00:30"
    },
    {
      "Data": [
        {
          "HistoryData": [
            {
              "HistoryRow": "First History Comment!",
              "Values": []
            },
            {
              "HistoryRow": "Reset of unlock time.",
              "Values": []
            }
          ],
          "UserData": {
            "UserEmail": "test3911606291400001@localunittest.com",
            "UserFirstname": "test3911606291400001",
            "UserFullname": "test3911606291400001 test3911606291400001",
            "UserID": 32,
            "UserLastname": "test3911606291400001"
          }
        }
      ],
      "TimeStamp": "2018-10-01 10:00:15"
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

    "ErrorIdentifier": "AlreadyLocked",
    "ErrorMessage": "Ticket is already locked."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LockFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to lock the ticket."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "OwnerSetFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to set the ticket owner."
  }
]

get

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • DetailUserData: (string)
  • External: (string)
  • Limit: (string)
  • OnlyLive: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns the lists of agents including their current roles.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Live": [
    {
      "UserAvatar": "data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGg...",
      "UserEmail": "john@doe.com",
      "UserFirstname": "John",
      "UserFullname": "John Doe",
      "UserID": 123,
      "UserLastname": "Doe",
      "UserLogin": "john",
      "UserRoles": {
        "Involved": 1,
        "Owner": 1,
        "Responsible": 0,
        "Watcher": 0
      }
    },
    {
      "AvatarLocation": "",
      "UserAvatar": "",
      "UserEmail": "jane@doe.com",
      "UserFirstname": "Jane",
      "UserFullname": "Jane Doe",
      "UserID": 234,
      "UserLastname": "Doe",
      "UserLogin": "jane",
      "UserRoles": {
        "Involved": 1,
        "Owner": 0,
        "Responsible": 1,
        "Watcher": 0
      }
    }
  ],
  "Other": [
    {
      "AvatarLocation": "",
      "UserAvatar": "",
      "UserEmail": "theo@example.com",
      "UserFirstname": "Theo",
      "UserFullname": "Theo Test",
      "UserID": 345,
      "UserLastname": "Test",
      "UserLogin": "theo",
      "UserRoles": {
        "Involved": 1,
        "Owner": 0,
        "Responsible": 0,
        "Watcher": 0
      }
    },
    {
      "AvatarLocation": "",
      "UserAvatar": "",
      "UserEmail": "theresa@example.com",
      "UserFirstname": "Theresa",
      "UserFullname": "Theresa Test",
      "UserID": 456,
      "UserLastname": "Test",
      "UserLogin": "theresa",
      "UserRoles": {
        "Involved": 1,
        "Owner": 0,
        "Responsible": 0,
        "Watcher": 1
      }
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/people/{UserID} get

get

Retrieve information about a specific person and ticket.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/people/{UserID}

Retrieve information about a specific person and ticket.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • UserID: required(string)

    Example:

    12

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • DetailUserData: (string)
  • External: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns the users data and ticket history.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "AdminCommunicationLogPageShown": "25",
  "AdminDynamicFieldsOverviewPageShown": "25",
  "AgentDocumentSearchPageShown": "10",
  "ChangeTime": "2018-11-28 16:13:23",
  "CreateTime": "2018-11-28 16:13:23",
  "HasAdminInterfaceAccess": 1,
  "UserEmail": "agent-1@localhost",
  "UserFAQJournalOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserFAQOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserFirstname": "agent-1",
  "UserFullname": "agent-1 agent-1",
  "UserID": 2,
  "UserLastLogin": "1544179880",
  "UserLastLoginTimestamp": "2018-12-07 10:51:20",
  "UserLastname": "agent-1",
  "UserLogin": "agent-1",
  "UserLoginFailed": "0",
  "UserMobile": "",
  "UserNotificationViewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserRefreshTime": "0",
  "UserTicketOverviewMediumPageShown": "20",
  "UserTicketOverviewPreviewPageShown": "15",
  "UserTicketOverviewSmallPageShown": "25",
  "UserTitle": null,
  "ValidID": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/print get head

get

Prints the information about a ticket.

head

Prints the information about a ticket.

get /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/print

Prints the information about a ticket.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ProcessEntityID: required(string)

    Example:

    Process-631b5a58cda6892c5ceb6b36072490be

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • EndpointContext: required(string)
  • FormID: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid ticket data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field2": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field3": {
      "Validator": "IncorrectDisplayConfig"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicketArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotPrepareData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The data could not be prepared for storage."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicFieldValue",
    "ErrorMessage": "The dynamic field values could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetTicketProcessState",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket process state could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket information could not be updated."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LinkFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "You do not have permission to link the ticket."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

    true

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

Access denied.

/api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/unlock post

post

Unlocks the ticket.

post /api/agent/ticket/{TicketID}/unlock

Unlocks the ticket.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • OwnerID: (string)

    Example:

    12

HTTP status code 200

Ticket successfully unlocked.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 403

Ticket action not available for the user.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "OwnerSetFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to set the ticket owner."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "UnlockFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "Failed to unlock the ticket."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/upload/{FormID} delete get post

delete

Delete a file upload from a FormID in the WebUploadCache.

get

Get a file upload from a FormID in the WebUploadCache.

post

Add a file upload to a FormID in the WebUploadCache.

delete /api/agent/upload/{FormID}

Secured by AgentAccessToken

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Filename: required(string)

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Example:

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

  }

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotDeleteFile",
    "ErrorMessage": "The attachment could not be deleted from the upload cache."
  }
]

Secured by AgentAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

  • Response
  • Security

  • FormID: required(string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • ContentID: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Returning the related attachment.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/octet-stream

Type: any

Example:

Some file content

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    1.0.0

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

    Example:

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

post /api/agent/upload/{FormID}

Add a file upload to a FormID in the WebUploadCache.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • FormID: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • Upload: (string)
  • upload: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Attachment successfully saved.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "FileID": 1,
  "uploaded": 1,
  "url": "/api/customer/upload/bbcbda800-31f3-11e8-a39e-6ba2f50ba514%40localhost"
}

HTTP status code 413

The attachment is too big to be uploaded.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Upload": {
      "Message": "Size limit exceeded!"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid upload or UploadFile!

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Upload": {
      "Message": "Invalid upload or UploadFile!"
    }
  }
}

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    1.0.0

Type: any

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotAddFile",
    "ErrorMessage": "The attachment could not be added to the upload cache."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationAgent' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

/api/agent/user-activity/list get

get

Handles the concurrent action messages by the FrontendClientID.

get /api/agent/user-activity/list

Handles the concurrent action messages by the FrontendClientID.

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • BusinessObjectID: (string)
  • BusinessObjectType: (string)
  • FrontendClientID: (string)
  • UserID: (string)
  • UserType: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns the concurrent action messages.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "UserActivity": [
    {
      "BusinessObjectID": 123,
      "BusinessObjectType": "846ba13b-367a-11e9-ab58-ffc271d3f95e",
      "ExpireTime": "2019-04-11 10:51:00",
      "FrontendClientID": "846ba13b-367a-11e9-ab58-ffc271d3f95e",
      "ID": 1,
      "UserID": "123",
      "UserType": "agent"
    }
  ]
}

Invalid input data.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationAgent=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-UserIsIdle: (string)

    Indicates that the user is not actively using the application any more. This will prevent updating the last access time stamp of the token and may lead to user logout after reaching the configured maximum idle period.

    Example:

    true
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeAgentLogin: (string)

    Fake agent authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/agent/web-notification/count post

post

post /api/agent/web-notification/count

Secured by AgentAccessToken

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Count": 1
}

/api/agent/web-notification/list post

post

List web notifications based on sort and filter parameters

post /api/agent/web-notification/list

List web notifications based on sort and filter parameters

Secured by AgentAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based agent authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ActiveFilters: (string)
  • AdditionalItemDataParams: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • GetAllItemIDs: (string)
  • GetUserActivity: (string)
  • ItemLimit: (string)
  • ItemsPerPage: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • PageFrom: (string)
  • PageUntil: (string)
  • PossibleFilterDynamicFields: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)

HTTP status code 200

List of available web notifications.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ItemList": [
    {
      "Comment": "some notification comment",
      "Name": "Notification 1",
      "NotificationID": 123
    },
    {
      "Comment": "some notification comment",
      "Name": "Notification 2",
      "NotificationID": 456
    }
  ],
  "ItemsTotal": 2,
  "PagesTotal": 1
}
