/api/customer/account get

get

Get related data of the currently logged in customer user.

get /api/customer/account

Get related data of the currently logged in customer user.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the customer user related data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ChangeBy": "1",
  "ChangeTime": "2018-02-23 08:28:32",
  "CreateBy": "1",
  "CreateTime": "2018-02-23 08:28:32",
  "CustomerCompanyValidID": null,
  "MultipleArticlesView": "0",
  "Source": "CustomerUser",
  "TicketListOrderBy": "Down",
  "TicketListSortBy": "Created",
  "TicketListTicketsPerPage": "10",
  "UserAvatar": "image content...",
  "UserCity": "",
  "UserComment": "",
  "UserCountry": "",
  "UserCustomerID": "example.com",
  "UserEmail": "theo@example.com",
  "UserFax": "",
  "UserFirstname": "Theo",
  "UserFullname": "Theo Test",
  "UserID": "theo",
  "UserLastLogin": "1523019398",
  "UserLastLoginTimestamp": "2018-04-06 12:56:38",
  "UserLastname": "Test",
  "UserLogin": "theo",
  "UserLoginFailed": "0",
  "UserMailString": "\"Theo Test\" <theo@example.com>",
  "UserMobile": "",
  "UserPhone": "",
  "UserRefreshTime": "0",
  "UserShowTickets": "25",
  "UserStreet": "",
  "UserTitle": "",
  "UserZip": "",
  "ValidID": "1"
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "PasswordChangeFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The password could not be changed. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

/api/customer/account/personal-preferences post

post

Save personal preferences of the currently logged in user.

post /api/customer/account/personal-preferences

Save personal preferences of the currently logged in user.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that the data was successfully saved

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Indicates that was some problem while validating the data

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Password": {
      "Data": [
        "8"
      ],
      "Message": "Password must have at least %d character(s)."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSaveUserPreference",
    "ErrorMessage": "The user preference setting could not be saved."
  }
]

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "EmailSendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The password recovery instructions could not be sent via email. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "MultipleAccountsFound",
    "ErrorMessage": "Multiple accounts with the same email address were found. Please contact the administrator."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ReadOnlyBackend",
    "ErrorMessage": "Could not send password recovery instructions via email because the used backend does not support it. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

/api/customer/account/register post

post

Register a new customer user account.

post /api/customer/account/register

Register a new customer user account.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • EmailAddress: required(string)
  • FirstName: required(string)
  • LastName: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Register a new customer user account.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "UserLogin": "customer@test.com"
}

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

Type: any

Example:

  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "AddingCustomerFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The new customer user could not be added."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "EmailAddressAlreadyExists",
    "ErrorMessage": "This e-mail address already exists. Please log in or reset your password."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "EmailAddressBlacklisted",
    "ErrorMessage": "This email address is not allowed to register. Please contact support staff."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "EmailSendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The email with new customer user account information could not be sent."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ReadOnlyBackend",
    "ErrorMessage": "The email with new customer user account information could not be sent. The used back end does not support it. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

/api/customer/account/twofactor/available-method-list get

get

Get avilable two-factor method list of for a customer.

get /api/customer/account/twofactor/available-method-list

Get avilable two-factor method list of for a customer.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the avilable two-factor method list for a customer.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "TwoFactorAvailableMethodList": [
    {
      "EnterSetupCodeMessage": {
        "Message": "Enter the 6-digit code that you see in your app"
      },
      "GetSetupErrorMessage": 1,
      "IsMethodSetupForUser": 1,
      "IsSendingTokenViaTransport": 0,
      "IsSetupPossible": 1,
      "Label": "App",
      "Name": "AuthenticatorApp"
    }
  ]
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/customer/account/twofactor/delete-setup/{TwoFactorMethod} post

post

Delete setup for given two-factor method.

post /api/customer/account/twofactor/delete-setup/{TwoFactorMethod}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TwoFactorMethod: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Returns the result of the two-factor setup delete.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DeleteSetupFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor method setup could not be deleted."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "DeleteSetupNotPossible",
    "ErrorMessage": "The setup can not be deleted. At least one two-factor setup is required."
  }
]

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

  • Response

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token could not be sent for the given two-factor method. The limit for this hour is reached."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token for the given method could not be sent. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

/api/customer/auth/check get

get

Checks if authentication token is valid.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

  • Response
  • Security

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 401

Authentication token is invalid.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/customer/auth/cookie get

get

Some endpoints cannot be accessed via the usual HTTP Authorize header, for example the fetching of inline images. Only for these, we use cookies. This endpoint is used to generate an httpOnly cookie with the token information in case the user does have a valid token. Otherwise, the cookie will be deleted.

get /api/customer/auth/cookie

Some endpoints cannot be accessed via the usual HTTP Authorize header, for example the fetching of inline images. Only for these, we use cookies. This endpoint is used to generate an httpOnly cookie with the token information in case the user does have a valid token. Otherwise, the cookie will be deleted.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Success response, will create or clear the access token cookie.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

/api/customer/auth/login post

post

Authenticate against the OTRS API (either with form or SSO data), creates an access token.

post /api/customer/auth/login

Authenticate against the OTRS API (either with form or SSO data), creates an access token.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • DeviceUUID: (string)
  • FromClient: (string)
  • IsInteractive: (string)
  • Password: (string)
  • TrustDevice: (string)
  • TwoFactorToken: (string)
  • Username: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Return access token after successful login.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "PostAuth": {
    "Config": {},
    "Modules": "PasswordChange"
  },
  "Token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJeyJhdWQiOiJjdXN0b21lc"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotGenerateToken",
    "ErrorMessage": "The token could not be generated."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitPerUserReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session per user limit is reached. Please try again later."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SessionLimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The session limit is reached. Please try again later."
  }
]

/api/customer/auth/logout post

post

Logout from the OTRS API, delete the token.

post /api/customer/auth/logout

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Logged out successfully.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

/api/customer/auth/postauth get

get

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

get /api/customer/auth/postauth

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the next post auth steps if a step is needed or nothing, if no step is needed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Config": {
    "ChangeAfterFirstLogin": 1
  },
  "Modules": "PasswordChange"
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/customer/auth/postauth/{Check} get

get

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

get /api/customer/auth/postauth/{Check}

Checks if some additional steps after the authentication are needed.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • Check: (string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return the next post auth steps if a step is needed or nothing, if no step is needed.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Config": {
    "ChangeAfterFirstLogin": 1
  },
  "Modules": "PasswordChange"
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

Bad token.

/api/customer/auth/sso-check get

get

Check customer user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

get /api/customer/auth/sso-check

Check customer user authentication against OTRS API via SSO data.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

User has passed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 401

User has failed the SSO authentication check.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "AuthTwoFactorRequired",
    "ErrorMessage": "A customer user is required to complete the two-factor authentication."
  }
]

/api/customer/auth/twofactor/send-token-via-transport/{TwoFactorMethod} post

post

  • Request
  • Response

URI Parameters

  • TwoFactorMethod: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Password: (string)
  • Username: (string)

HTTP status code 200

OTP Token was successfully send with the given two-factor method.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "LimitReached",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token could not be sent for the given two-factor method. The limit for this hour is reached."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "SendingFailed",
    "ErrorMessage": "The two-factor OTP token for the given method could not be sent. Please contact the administrator."
  }
]

post

Type: object

  • Username: (string)

Returns the configured two-factor methods for the customer auth.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

  "TwoFactorSetupList": [
    {
      "Label": "App",
      "Name": "AuthenticatorApp",
      "RequestVerificationCodeMessage": {
        "Message": "Request verification code through %s",
        "Placeholder": "App"
      }
    }
  ]
}

Invalid input data.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    1.0.0

Type: any

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }

/api/customer/personal-notifications/list get

get

Get personal notifications.

get /api/customer/personal-notifications/list

Get personal notifications.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • NotificationsPerPage: (string)
  • ObjectType: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • Seen: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Returns a list of personal notifications.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "List": [
    {
      "Content": {
        "Body": "some body",
        "Comment": "",
        "CreateTime": "2018-08-27 14:24:20",
        "Description": "some description",
        "NotificationID": 68,
        "ObjectID": 123,
        "ObjectReference": "54321",
        "ObjectType": "Ticket",
        "Seen": 0,
        "TicketNumber": "123456",
        "Title": "some title",
        "UserID": 123,
        "UserType": "Customer"
      },
      "Marker": {
        "NotificationID": 68,
        "Status": "Unread"
      }
    }
  ],
  "TotalNotifications": 1
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post

Set personal notifications as read.

post /api/customer/personal-notifications/seen-set

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Filter: required(string)
  • NotificationID: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Seen flag was set.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

/api/customer/ticket post

post

Create a new ticket.

post /api/customer/ticket

Create a new ticket.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Body: required(string)
  • FormID: (string)
  • PriorityID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • QueueID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • SLAID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ServiceID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Title: required(string)
  • TypeID: (string)

    Example:

    1234

HTTP status code 200

Created the ticket successfully.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "NextScreenAfterNewTicket": "TicketOverview",
  "TicketNumber": "2018061740123"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  }
]

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 403

/api/customer/ticket/list get

get

Get a list of tickets.

get /api/customer/ticket/list

Get a list of tickets.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • CompanyTickets: (string)
  • DynamicFields: (string)
  • Extended: (string)
  • LastCustomerSubject: (string)
  • Page: (string)
  • Search: (string)
  • SortAscending: (string)
  • SortBy: (string)
  • StateFilter: (string)
  • TicketsPerPage: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Return the ticket list.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "List": [
    {
      "Age": 97123,
      "ArchiveFlag": "n",
      "ChangeBy": 1,
      "Changed": "2018-08-13 07:28:21",
      "CreateBy": 1,
      "Created": "2018-08-13 07:28:21",
      "CreatedByUser": "John Doe",
      "CustomerID": "customer-1",
      "CustomerUserID": "customer-1",
      "DynamicField_Checkbox": {
        "TranslatableValues": 1,
        "Value": ""
      },
      "EscalationResponseTime": 0,
      "EscalationSolutionTime": 0,
      "EscalationTime": 0,
      "EscalationUpdateTime": 0,
      "GroupID": 1,
      "Lock": "unlock",
      "LockID": 1,
      "Marker": "Unread",
      "Owner": "root@localhost",
      "OwnerID": 1,
      "Priority": "3 normal",
      "PriorityID": 3,
      "Queue": "Misc",
      "QueueID": 4,
      "RealTillTimeNotUsed": 0,
      "Responsible": "root@localhost",
      "ResponsibleID": 1,
      "SLAID": "",
      "ServiceID": "",
      "State": "new",
      "StateID": 1,
      "StateType": "new",
      "TicketID": 13,
      "TicketNumber": "2018081354000023",
      "Title": "Ticket #2",
      "Type": "Unclassified",
      "TypeID": 1,
      "UnlockTimeout": 0,
      "UntilTime": 0
    }
  ],
  "TotalTickets": 1
}

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid ticket data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field2": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field3": {
      "Validator": "IncorrectDisplayConfig"
    }
  }
}

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicketArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotPrepareData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The data could not be prepared for storage."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicFieldValue",
    "ErrorMessage": "The dynamic field values could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetTicketProcessState",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket process state could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket information could not be updated."
  }
]

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/customer/ticket/process/{TicketID} get

get

Returns the information about a process ticket.

get /api/customer/ticket/process/{TicketID}

Returns the information about a process ticket.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • EndpointContext: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that data was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

/api/customer/ticket/{TicketID}/article post

post

Creates the new article for the given ticket

post /api/customer/ticket/{TicketID}/article

Creates the new article for the given ticket

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • Body: required(string)
  • FormID: (string)
  • NextStateID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • PriorityID: (string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Subject: required(string)

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that the article was successfully create

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ArticleID": 123,
  "NextScreenAfterFollowUp": "TicketOverview"
}

HTTP status code 403

Indicates that it's not possible to reopen the given ticket or the user hasn't access to the the ticket.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Error": "Can't reopen ticket, not possible in this queue!"
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicField",
    "ErrorMessage": "A dynamic field value could not be set."
  }
]

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

  • DynamicFields: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

      "Message": "..."

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • Response
  • Security

    Example:

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Indicates that the attachment was successfully returned.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Indicates that the access to the attachment is denied (No access to the ticket or the article is not visible).

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 404

Indicates that the attachment was not found.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

/api/customer/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/body get

get

Get article body related to TicketID and ArticleID.

get /api/customer/ticket/{TicketID}/article/{ArticleID}/body

Get article body related to TicketID and ArticleID.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • TicketID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • ArticleID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Return article body.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: text/html

Type: any

Example:

<pre>Some example article body!</pre>

    Example:

    true

Media type: application/json

Type: object

  • FormID: (string)

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid ticket data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field2": {
      "Attributes": {
        "Arguments": null,
        "Source": null,
        "Value": null
      },
      "Validator": "Required"
    },
    "Field3": {
      "Validator": "IncorrectDisplayConfig"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotCreateTicketArticle",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket article could not be created."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotPrepareData",
    "ErrorMessage": "The data could not be prepared for storage."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetDynamicFieldValue",
    "ErrorMessage": "The dynamic field values could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotSetTicketProcessState",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket process state could not be set."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "CouldNotUpdateTicket",
    "ErrorMessage": "The ticket information could not be updated."
  }
]

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

Headers

  • Authorization: (string)

    Used to send the JSON Web Token. Alternatively, you can send an 'AuthenticationCustomer' cookie header value that contains the token.

    Example:

    Bearer [token]
  • Cookie: (string)

    Use this to send the token in browser based contexts where custom HTTP headers cannot be set. Cookie authentication is only supported by some endpoints that cannot operate with the normal authentication header.

    Example:

    AuthenticationCustomer=[token]
  • X-OTRS-API-FakeCustomerLogin: (string)

    Fake customer authentication (works on development server only!)

    Example:

    testuser_login

HTTP status code 401

Bad token.

HTTP status code 403

Access denied.

post /api/customer/upload/{FormID}

Add a file upload to a FormID in the WebUploadCache.

Secured by CustomerAccessToken

JSON Web Token (RFC 7519) based customer authentication via header or cookie.

  • Request
  • Response
  • Security

URI Parameters

  • FormID: required(string)

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Query Parameters

  • Upload: (string)
  • upload: (string)

HTTP status code 200

Attachment successfully saved.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "FileID": 1,
  "uploaded": 1,
  "url": "/api/customer/upload/bbcbda800-31f3-11e8-a39e-6ba2f50ba514%40localhost"
}

HTTP status code 413

The attachment is too big to be uploaded.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Upload": {
      "Message": "Size limit exceeded!"
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 422

Invalid upload or UploadFile!

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Upload": {
      "Message": "Invalid upload or UploadFile!"
    }
  }
}

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    }
  }
}

/api/public/chat/accept-request post

post

Accepts a chat request.

post /api/public/chat/accept-request

Accepts a chat request.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: object

Properties
  • ChatID: required(string)

    Example:

    1234
  • Language: (string)

HTTP status code 200

The chat was successfully accepted.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 403

Access unauthorized.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}

HTTP status code 900

Custom error response, see example for a list of possible responses.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ChatNotAsRequest",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat request could not be processed."
  },
  {
    "ErrorIdentifier": "ChatTargetTypeDontMatch",
    "ErrorMessage": "The chat request could not be processed."
  }
]

/api/public/chat/available-channels get

get

get /api/public/chat/available-channels

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

Returns a list of available chat channels.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    1.0.0

Type: any

Example:

[
  {
    "ID": 1,
    "Name": "Chat channel name"
  }
]

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

  • Response

Type: object

  • ChatID: required(string)

    Example:

/api/public/chat/config get

get

Returns the configuration settings for the chat feature.

get /api/public/chat/config

Returns the configuration settings for the chat feature.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Indicates that config was successfully returned.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "ChatEngine::ChatDirection::CustomerToAgent": 1,
  "ChatEngine::ChatDirection::PublicToAgent": 1,
  "ChatEngine::DefaultAgentName": "Support Agent",
  "ChatEngine::DefaultAgentNameNumbers": 1,
  "ChatEngine::ExternalFrontend::AllowChatChannels": 1,
  "ChatEngine::ExternalFrontend::NoAnswerThreshold": 5
}

/api/public/chat/history get

get

Get chat conversation history.

get /api/public/chat/history

Get chat conversation history.

  • Request
  • Response

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug: (string)

    Optional, enables debugging information in responses based on the settings in WebApp.conf.

    Example:

    true

HTTP status code 200

Get chat conversation history.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Active": [
    {
      "ActiveUsers": [
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "LastMessageTime": "2018-09-14 18:48:51"
        },
        {
          "ChatterID": "4",
          "ChatterName": "Test Test",
          "ChatterType": "User",
          "LastMessageTime": "2018-09-14 22:01:50"
        }
      ],
      "Channel": "test",
      "ChannelID": 2,
      "ChatID": 1,
      "ChatMessages": [
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 18:48:51",
          "ID": 1,
          "MessageText": "Theo Test has joined this chat.<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 1
        },
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 18:48:51",
          "ID": 2,
          "MessageText": "help<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 0
        },
        {
          "ChatterID": "4",
          "ChatterName": "Test Test",
          "ChatterType": "User",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 22:01:37",
          "ID": 5,
          "MessageText": "Test Test has joined this chat.<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 1
        },
        {
          "ChatterID": "4",
          "ChatterName": "Test Test",
          "ChatterType": "User",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 22:01:50",
          "ID": 6,
          "MessageText": "what?<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 0
        }
      ],
      "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 18:48:51",
      "Invitation": 0,
      "Order": 0,
      "RequesterID": "tt",
      "RequesterName": "Theo Test",
      "RequesterType": "Customer",
      "Status": "active",
      "TargetType": "User",
      "TicketID": 0
    }
  ],
  "Closed": [],
  "IncomingRequests": [],
  "OutgoingRequests": [
    {
      "ActiveUsers": [
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "LastMessageTime": "2018-09-14 21:54:59"
        }
      ],
      "Channel": "test",
      "ChannelID": 2,
      "ChatID": 2,
      "ChatMessages": [
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 21:54:59",
          "ID": 3,
          "MessageText": "Theo Test has joined this chat.<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 1
        },
        {
          "ChatterID": "tt",
          "ChatterName": "Theo Test",
          "ChatterType": "Customer",
          "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 21:54:59",
          "ID": 4,
          "MessageText": "xxxx<br/>\n",
          "SystemGenerated": 0
        }
      ],
      "CreateTime": "2018-09-14 21:54:59",
      "Invitation": 0,
      "Order": 0,
      "RequesterID": "tt",
      "RequesterName": "Theo Test",
      "RequesterType": "Customer",
      "Status": "request",
      "TargetType": "User",
      "TicketID": 0
    }
  ]
}

HTTP status code 403

Access unauthorized.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

HTTP status code 422

Invalid input data.

Headers

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-SQLTrace: (string)

    Includes SQL debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_sql_trace' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Debug-STDERRLog: (string)

    Includes STDERR debugging information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent and 'enable_debugger_stderr_log' is enabled.

  • X-OTRS-API-Version: required(string)

    Provides endpoint version information, if 'X-OTRS-API-Debug' was sent.

    Example:

    1.0.0

Body

Media type: application/json

Type: any

Example:

{
  "Errors": {
    "Field1": {
      "Message": "..."
    }
  }
}
